page.title: 02CHANGING FACE OF DRUMOAK
page.content: During the past twenty years significant changes in the shape of the parish landscape have occurred. The once famous Royal Deeside Railway which passed through Drumoak en route to Balmoral has been lifted.In place of the station yard there is now a caravan site.Many field dykes (walls) shown in 1970 OS Map 1:10560 have been demolished as farmers make larger fields to suit large scale farming. On the roadways the A93 traversing Drumoak from East to West is no longer a quiet country road but a busy route for commuter transport to Aberdeen. The village of Drumoak has also grown with recent building of 60 municipal and over 100 private houses. Despite the changes including the influx of population,Drumoak still has a quiet rural community atmosphere.
